title: Govt allocates Rs.851 million for Finance Division projects
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 10 (APP):The government on Tuesday allocated Rs.851.580 million for six ongoing scheme of the Finance Division in Public Sector Development Programme (PSDP) 2025-26.
According to the Budgetary documents, out of total allocation this year, Rs.164.580 million would be utilized for Implementation and Mainstreaming of Audit Management Information System (AMIS) and Rs.57 million for Implementation of PFM Policy framework in federal government.
Likewise, the government would spend Rs.150 million for modernization and upgradation of Pakistan Mint (Phase-II-A); and Rs.330 million for Pakistan Audit and Account Academy (PAAA) Islamabad (PC1).
The government allocated Rs.50 million for implementation of online billing solution (Sehel) under the PFM Reforms at Fedeal and provincial level (PC1); and Rs.100 million for Women Inclusive Finance scheme.
